intro: Codonoboea elegans, commonly known as the elegant codonopsis, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its attractive, showy flowers. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial with slender stems and opposite leaves. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, with five petals and prominent stamens. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders.
